meanings.definition: To grant or confer a formal recognition or approval
meanings.sent1: The mayor will be breveting the outstanding students at the ceremony.
meanings.sent2: The committee will brevet the new regulations next week.
meanings.sent3: The teacher joked that she would be breveting the best homework with a gold star.
meanings.sent4: The judge breveted the talented singer as the winner of the competition.
meanings.sent5: The president breveted the hero with a medal for bravery.

meanings.definition: To document or certify the completion of a certain training or qualification
meanings.sent1: The university will be breveting the graduates' diplomas this afternoon.
meanings.sent2: The company brevets the employees' skills after each training session.
meanings.sent3: The chef playfully said he would brevet the new cooks with a 'master chef' certificate.
meanings.sent4: The school breveted the students' achievements with official certificates.
meanings.sent5: The coach breveted the team's hard work with certificates of completion.

meanings.definition: To officially authorize or approve something
meanings.sent1: The government will brevet the construction of the new bridge.
meanings.sent2: The board will brevet the budget for the upcoming project.
meanings.sent3: The parents jokingly said they would brevet the children's request for a pet elephant.
meanings.sent4: The committee breveted the proposal for the new community center.
meanings.sent5: The manager breveted the plan for the event with a stamp of approval.
